attributes.title: OCULUS ON TRIAL! $2 Billion Lawsuit Over VR
attributes.caption: Jan 12, 2017
attributes.description: The big lawsuit against Oculus has begun and it is off to a SALTY start. Did Oculus steal its tech? Did Facebook know? How lawyered up is this going to get?
attributes.display_title: OCULUS ON TRIAL! $2 Billion Lawsuit Over VR

attributes.title: THE DEATH OF VINE... RIP
attributes.caption: Jan 17, 2017
attributes.description: They say we die a second at a time. Probably. In Vine's case... it's died six seconds at a time.

attributes.title: Windows 10 Makes PC Games BETTER?
attributes.caption: Jan 26, 2017
attributes.description: An upcoming Game Mode for Windows 10 promises to improve PC game performance... but can you trust it?

attributes.title: Twitch Taking On STEAM?
attributes.caption: Everybody thinks they can take on Steam, but one company that actually stands a chance may be throwing its hat in the ring. Amazon has been filing some new patents that hint to a new service that combines Steam... and Twitch?

attributes.title: Oculus Defeated in Court, Rift DEAD??
attributes.description: The trial for virtual reality has just been decided by a jury... and Oculus lost. Fortunately for them, Facebook will help cover the damage, but less fortunately, ZeniMax might move to stop the Rift from being sold. So what does this mean for VR?
attributes.display_title: Oculus Defeated in Court, Rift DEAD??

attributes.title: Windows 10 Is RANSOMWARE?
attributes.description: Epic CEO Tim Sweeney's got a beef with Windows, and now he's stepped up his game. In his latest rants against the platform, he's saying that Windows is going to start holding your PC games hostage. Probably not with a gun, but MAYBE.

attributes.title: ANOTHER YouTube Unsubscribe Bug!
attributes.description: YouTube's got another unsubbing problem, and this time it was used to maliciously target popular channels. But on the bright side, at least YouTube acknowledged that this unsubscribe bug actually exists this time. So hey, progress!

attributes.title: Time Warner Sued for SABOTAGING Gamers!
attributes.caption: Feb 13, 2017
attributes.description: People are always accusing ISPs of not living up to their advertising, but now Riot Games has supplied some proof that one provider might have been sabotaging League of Legends games on purpose with slower speeds. Now, the state of New York is stepping in and suing, because why not?
attributes.display_title: Time Warner Sued for SABOTAGING Gamers!

attributes.title: Metacritic is ANTI-COMPETITIVE?
attributes.caption: Feb 22, 2017
attributes.description: Game review aggregator Metacritic has become a staple in the videogame industry for bringing together all the biggest reviews for games, doing some secret math, and handing out an aggregate score. But there's a new kid in town, OpenCritic, and they're accusing Metacritic of anti-competitive practices to keep out competition.

attributes.title: Graphics Card Murderer Sentenced to Prison
attributes.caption: Feb 22, 2017
attributes.description: A few months ago, a Russian man made headlines after being charged with the murder of a friend over a disagreement about which graphics card was superior. That case has made its way through court and now the dude's headed for prison.
attributes.display_title: Graphics Card Murderer Sentenced to Prison

attributes.title: Project Scorpio Improvements LEAKED
attributes.caption: Project Scorpio, the newest Xbox console, is coming soon from Microsoft, but what's under the hood? Thanks to some leaks, we know a little more about the alleged "most advanced console ever."

attributes.title: YouTube HIDING Gaming Videos!
attributes.caption: Mar 21, 2017
attributes.description: YouTube is in hot water with creators and users again over accusations the platform is automatically hiding videos from restricted users for containing objectionable content.

attributes.title: YouTube BOYCOTT By Advertisers! Break out #YouTubeIsOverParty
attributes.caption: Mar 24, 2017
attributes.description: YouTube's having a rough time. In addition to backlash from creators over things like restricted mode, now advertisers are boycotting the platform because it doesn't do ENOUGH to protect brands from accidental advertisement on content they find objectionable.
attributes.display_title: YouTube BOYCOTT By Advertisers! Break out #YouTubeIsOverParty

attributes.title: GOODBYE OCULUS! Rift Creator's Big Exit
attributes.caption: Mar 31, 2017
attributes.description: Oculus creator Palmer Luckey has been a touchy subject for a while now--first there was the lawsuit alleging that he and John Carmack stole technology from ZeniMax. Then there was that whole thing with funding shitposting groups during the US election that had game developers pulling support for Oculus. Well, it's reached its end game because now he and his hundreds of millions of dollars are parting ways with Oculus.
attributes.display_title: GOODBYE OCULUS! Rift Creator's Big Exit

attributes.title: Required Streaming License Costs THOUSANDS of Dollars!?
attributes.caption: Apr 11, 2017
attributes.description: Another government is requiring game streamers to pay thousands of dollars for a radio broadcasting license. What does this mean for streamers around the world?
attributes.display_title: Required Streaming License Costs THOUSANDS of Dollars!?

attributes.title: Money GONE for YouTube Content Creators?
attributes.caption: Apr 25, 2017
attributes.description: YouTube creators are reporting that YouTube's new ad policies have hit them even harder than expected, and that they won't be able to keep making content the way they were before if this continues.
attributes.display_title: Money GONE for YouTube Content Creators?

attributes.title: JAIL TIME for DDoS Mastermind
attributes.caption: Apr 26, 2017
attributes.description: a "hacker" or rather a script kiddie who created and sold DDoS software responsible for millions of DDoS attacks on gaming networks like Xbox Live has received a jail sentence to (hopefully) send a message.

attributes.title: Fidget Spinners TAKE OVER Adult Videos?
attributes.caption: May 25, 2017
attributes.description: Did you have some faith in humanity left? Let's just erase that for you. You know those fidget spinners everyone's going crazy over? They're going REALLY crazy. Like looking for tons of fidget spinner...um... adult oriented videos. You know what we mean. This is the darkest timeline, but at least it's entertaining.
attributes.display_title: Fidget Spinners TAKE OVER Adult Videos?

attributes.title: Do You Even OWN Your CONSOLE? Supreme Court Weighs In
attributes.caption: May 31, 2017
attributes.description: There's been an ongoing legal battle between patent owners and users about who actually OWNS the console you bought and what you're allowed to do with it. Self repair? Modding? All part of it. The Supreme Court has now weighed in on a case that may set the precedent for hardware ownership and pave the way for future software cases.
attributes.display_title: Do You Even OWN Your CONSOLE? Supreme Court Weighs In

attributes.title: Why is the Internet SO SLOW?
attributes.caption: July 12, 2017
attributes.description: Notice a bunch of loading bars and talk about net neutrality today? That's because internet companies are taking a stand against the FCC's plans to remove net neutrality protections. Here's what all that means and why it matters.
attributes.display_title: Why is the Internet SO SLOW?

attributes.title: YouTube Secretly HIDING Videos?
attributes.caption: Aug 2, 2017
attributes.description: We're all used to this new post-adpocalypse YouTube, so it's time for the video giant to ruffle more feathers by secretly hiding videos that don't break guidelines but that they don't really like anyway.

attributes.title: Disney's Illegal SPY Apps?
attributes.caption: Aug 10, 2017
attributes.description: Disney is under legal fire over accusations that more than 40 smartphone apps are spying on users, including kids, and then selling that information in violation of COPPA.

attributes.title: Discord vs FREE SPEECH!? nope.
attributes.caption: Aug 16, 2017
attributes.description: Discord's in the spotlight for banning a server belonging to the Alt Right political group, with similar moves following from GoDaddy, Reddit, Google, and others. This has some decrying the death of free speech on the internet. Except... that's not how free speech works.

attributes.title: Prank Family Facing 10 YEARS in Prison?!
attributes.caption: Infamous YouTube family DaddyOFive got themselves in some hot water earlier this year with a series of "prank" videos against their children. Now, after losing custody of the two youngest and getting charges filed against them, it looks like they could be
attributes.display_title: Prank Family Facing 10 YEARS in Prison?!

attributes.title: Fair Use Lawsuit WIN Big for YouTube
attributes.caption: Aug 24, 2017
attributes.description: Ethan and Hila Klein of the H3H3Productions YouTube channel have spend the past year and a half fighting a lawsuit in court over fair use. The judgement on the lawsuit is in and could have a significant impact on fair use interpretation for YouTube videos in the future.
attributes.display_title: Fair Use Lawsuit WIN Big for YouTube

attributes.title: Gaming Channels DYING on YouTube?
attributes.caption: Aug 24, 2017
attributes.description: YouTube says advertisers are back, but it looks like all those dollars are coming at the cost of gaming videos on the platform. Gaming YouTubers are coming out en masse to report demonetized videos and dropping revenue that's driving them to other platforms like Twitch.

attributes.title: Google CENSORING Critics?
attributes.caption: Sept 6, 2017
attributes.description: Google's been accused by multiple sources of intentionally burying search results to content critical of its practices and even getting critics booted from partnered programs, on top of YouTubers claiming the adpocalypse is driving them off the platform.

attributes.title: New iPhone: INNOVATIVE or OUT OF IDEAS?
attributes.caption: Sept 12, 2017
attributes.description: Apple unveiled not 2, but 3 new iPhones! They must be doing some CRAZY cool stuff for 3 whole iPhones, right? Enter Animojis. FaceID. More glass! We tease, but let's be honest, we'll probably buy them.
attributes.display_title: New iPhone: INNOVATIVE or OUT OF IDEAS?

attributes.title: War for DRM is OVER! Big Business WINS?
attributes.caption: Sept 19, 2017
attributes.description: DRM for streaming video is about to change dramatically, and not necessarily for the better, thanks to a new standard that could bring criminal charges to anyone who even looks at it funny. So... gird your browsers and get your malware protection ready (as long as it doesn't give you malware, itself...).
attributes.display_title: War for DRM is OVER! Big Business WINS?

attributes.title: YouTube SAVES Gaming?
attributes.caption: Sept 19, 2017
attributes.description: It's no secret that YouTube gaming content creators have been having a tough time with advertising on the platform falling. YouTube to the rescue! It's got a daring plan to help these creators make money again! Just... become Twitch, basically!

attributes.title: YouTube CRACKS DOWN on Patreon & Alternate Revenue
attributes.caption: Sept 29, 2017
attributes.description: Since the adpocalypse a number of YouTube creators have turned to alternate revenue streams like Patreon, but YouTube is now cracking down on smaller channels with restrictions on what they can link to.
attributes.display_title: YouTube CRACKS DOWN on Patreon & Alternate Revenue

attributes.title: YouTube FIXES Demonetization?
attributes.description: YouTube's had a demonetization problem for the better part of 2017, and now the company says those problems could be going away for good. Will their new algorithm update solve all of the demonetization woes?

attributes.title: Net Neutrality Under ATTACK
attributes.caption: We thought net neutrality had been won, but it may be thrown out in less than a month so your ISP can get in on the microtransaction game. Hey, it's working so well for EA and Star Wars, who can blame them?
attributes.description: We thought net neutrality had been won, but it may be thrown out in less than a month so your ISP can get in on the microtransaction game. Hey, it's working so well for EA and Star Wars, who can blame them?

attributes.title: Is The AdPocalypse OVER?
attributes.description: Youtube is exploring "non-ad-based monetization opportunities", does this mean that the dreaded AdPocalypse is finally coming to an end?

attributes.title: The Adpocalypse is WORSE THAN EVER?
attributes.caption: Early this year advertisers boycotted YouTube over objectionable content. It seemed like it might be getting better, but a new round of boycotts could leave it worse than ever.
attributes.description: Early this year advertisers boycotted YouTube over objectionable content. It seemed like it might be getting better, but a new round of boycotts could leave it worse than ever.
attributes.display_title: The Adpocalypse is WORSE THAN EVER?

attributes.title: Google SUED for BILLIONS
attributes.caption: Google's no stranger to lawsuits over privacy violations. Millions of iPhone users could see big paydays for privacy violations in a new class action lawsuit.
attributes.description: Google's no stranger to lawsuits over privacy violations. Wow. We're at the point where that's an everyday occurrence, and it's not getting better. At least there's money in it this time. Millions of iPhone users could see big paydays for privacy violations in a new class action lawsuit.

attributes.title: Patreon SCREWS OVER Creators & Patrons
attributes.caption: A new change to Patreon's billing system is set to ruin smaller creators and patrons who can't afford large donations... all in the name of PROGRESS!
attributes.description: A new change to Patreon's billing system is set to ruin smaller creators and patrons who can't afford large donations... all in the name of PROGRESS!

attributes.title: Patreon BACKS DOWN! Creators SAVED?
attributes.caption: A few days ago Patreon announced a new pricing structure that caused patrons to ditch the platform and lost a ton of money for creators. Now they've backed down. Is that enough?
attributes.description: A few days ago Patreon announced a new pricing structure that caused patrons to ditch the platform and lost a ton of money for creators. Now they've backed down. Is that enough? How will they make it up to creators who've lost income?
